ai-dn22:13.5_0: When they have ill will in them they understand ‘I have ill will in me’; and when they don’t have ill will in them they understand ‘I don’t have ill will in me’. ai-dn22:18.1_0: And what is the noble truth of suffering?
ai-dn22:18.2_0: Rebirth is suffering; old age is suffering; death is suffering; sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress are suffering; association with the disliked is suffering; separation from the liked is suffering; not getting what you wish for is suffering. ai-dn22:20.35_0: feeling born of mind contact in the world seems nice and pleasant, and it is there that craving is given up and ceases.
ai-dn22:20.41_0: perception of thoughts in the world seems nice and pleasant, and it is there that craving is given up and ceases.
ai-dn22:20.47_0: intention regarding thoughts in the world seems nice and pleasant, and it is there that craving is given up and ceases.
ai-dn22:20.53_0: craving for thoughts in the world seems nice and pleasant, and it is there that craving is given up and ceases.
ai-dn22:20.59_0: thoughts about thoughts in the world seem nice and pleasant, and it is there that craving is given up and ceases.
ai-dn22:20.65_0: Considerations regarding thoughts in the world seem nice and pleasant, and it is there that craving is given up and ceases.
ai-dn22:20.66_0: This I say, monks, is the noble truth of the cessation of suffering.
ai-dn22:21.1_0: Now what, monks, is the Noble Truth of the Practice Leading to the Cessation of Suffering?
ai-dn22:21.3_0: right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right immersion.
ai-dn22:21.4_0: Now what, monks, is right view?
ai-dn22:21.5_0: Knowing about suffering, the origin of suffering, the cessation of suffering, and the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering.
ai-dn22:21.10_0: Now what, monks, is right speech?
ai-dn22:21.11_0: refraining from speech that’s false, divisive, harsh, or nonsensical.
ai-dn22:21.12_0: This, monks, is called right speech.
ai-dn22:21.14_0: Refraining from killing living creatures, stealing, and sexual misconduct.
ai-dn22:21.16_0: Now what, monks, is right livelihood?
ai-dn22:21.17_0: It’s when a noble disciple gives up wrong livelihood and earns a living by right livelihood.
ai-dn22:21.18_0: This, monks, is called right livelihood.
ai-dn22:21.20_0: It’s when a mendicant generates enthusiasm, tries, makes an effort, exerts the mind, and strives so that bad, unskillful qualities don’t arise. ...
ai-dn22:21.21_0: They generate enthusiasm, try, make an effort, exert the mind, and strive so that bad, unskillful qualities that have arisen are given up.
ai-dn22:21.22_0: They generate enthusiasm, try, make an effort, exert the mind, and strive so that skillful qualities that have not arisen do arise.
ai-dn22:21.23_0: so that skillful qualities that have arisen remain, are not lost, but increase, mature, and are completed by development.
ai-dn22:21.26_0: It’s when a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of the body—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
ai-dn22:21.28_0: They meditate observing an aspect of the mind—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
ai-dn22:21.29_0: principles—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
ai-dn22:21.31_0: Now what, monks, is right concentration?
ai-dn22:21.32_0: Now, take a mendicant who, quite secluded from sensual pleasures, secluded from unskillful qualities, enters and remains in the first absorption, which has the rapture and bliss born of seclusion, while placing the mind and keeping it connected.
ai-dn22:21.33_0: As the placing of the mind and keeping it connected are stilled, they enter and remain in the second absorption ...
ai-dn22:21.34_0: And with the fading away of rapture, they enter and remain in the third absorption, where they meditate with equanimity, mindful and aware, personally experiencing the bliss of which the noble ones declare, ‘Equanimous and mindful, one meditates in bliss.’
ai-dn22:21.35_0: Giving up pleasure and pain, and ending former happiness and sadness, they enter and remain in the fourth absorption, without pleasure or pain, with pure equanimity and mindfulness.
ai-dn22:21.37_0: This, monks, is called the Noble Truth of the Practice Leading to the Cessation of Suffering.
ai-dn22:21.38_0: And so they meditate observing an aspect of principles internally ...
ai-dn22:21.39_0: They meditate observing principles as liable to originate, as liable to vanish, and as liable to both originate and vanish.
ai-dn22:21.40_0: Or mindfulness is established that principles exist, to the extent necessary for knowledge and mindfulness. They meditate independent, not grasping at anything in the world.
ai-dn22:21.41_0: That’s how a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of principles with respect to the four noble truths.
ai-dn22:21.42_0: The group of eight is finished.
ai-dn22:21.43_0: The Book of the Teaching is finished.
ai-dn22:22.1_0: Anyone who develops these four kinds of mindfulness meditation in this way for seven years can expect one of two results:
ai-dn22:22.2_0: enlightenment in the present life, or if there’s something left over, non-return.
ai-dn22:22.4_0: anyone who develops these four kinds of mindfulness meditation in this way for six years ...
ai-dn22:22.12_0: enlightenment in the present life, or if there’s something left over, non-return.
ai-dn22:22.22_0: anyone who develops these four kinds of mindfulness meditation in this way for seven days can expect one of two results:
ai-dn22:22.23_0: enlightenment in the present life, or if there’s something left over, non-return.
ai-dn22:22.24_0: ‘The four kinds of mindfulness meditation are the path to convergence. They are in order to purify sentient beings, to get past sorrow and crying, to make an end of pain and sadness, to end the cycle of suffering, and to realize extinguishment.’
ai-dn22:22.25_0: That’s what I said, and this is why I said it.”
ai-dn22:22.26_0: That is what the Buddha said.
ai-dn22:22.27_0: Satisfied, the mendicants were happy with what the Buddha said.
ai-dn22:22.28_0: The ninth substance of mindfulness meditation is finished.
